reviews.review: Развлекательная головоломка. Весело играть вдвоем.

Fun at first, but a tad too easy compared to the trailers. Short as well if you know what you're doing, and it some cases the game prevents you from making a mistake. Lots of good ideas scrapped due to play testers whining it was too hard.
More fun than shitting dick nipples

The game for EVERYONE. Whether you're a hardcore gamer or never played a video game before, this is the one that shows the power of video games, why they're such a unique medium of entertainment and generally sticks a middle finger to all the critics of video games. It's educational, fun, co-operative, hilarious, challenging (in co-op anyways), has tons of replay value, a lot of variety, improved visuals, a good story and innovative gameplay.

Eine gelungene Fortsetzung von Portal 1!
Die Story knüpft sich wunderbar mit denn ersten teil zusammen und es gibt viele neue sachen. Beispielweise denn "Solar-Weg" wo man drauf gehen kann. 
Das Map Design ist auch einfach nur der Wahnsinn, weil diese hier etwas schwerer gemacht wurden und noch genialer. Ich finde dieses Spiel muss man gezockt haben. Wie? Du hast kein Online Freund der mit dir Co-Op spielt? Kein Problem mit ein bisschen manipulation kann man Splitscreen auch auf denn PC spielen (XBOX Controller und PC Tastatur).
Die Portalgun wurde auch verbessert, man hat jetzt bessere Präzision und man hat jetzt einen Zoom womit das Zielen deutlich einfacher fällt, aber der nie benutzt wird.
Der Map-Editor wird bald kommen, ich freue mich schon drauf!
Der einzige Kritik Punkt: Die Level laden sich immer nur der größe nach. Also hat man bei einem kleinen Raum mehr FPS als in einem großen Raum mit viel Effekten.
Ich freue mich schon auf die weiteren Portal teile!

First off--fantastic game. Playing the original Portal is a must to fully enjoy what this game offers. The puzzles pushes your mind to its limit and the game blends story, dialogue, and humor so well together. Co-op is even more enjoyable when you have a partner to solve puzzles or goof around. Worth the investment.
The first game was amaizing and this one follows in it's footsteps. Highly recommended!

This is probably my Game of the Year for 2011. I think it's one of Valve's best creations with a perfect blend of snark, humor, and amazing puzzle action. I have yet to play Co-op, but the single player is worth replaying again and again even after I know the solutions to the puzzles.

Se pensavate che già il primo fosse geniale, non vi aspetterete mai quello che può riservarvi questo secondo capitolo. Ah, ha alcuni tra i personaggi più espressivi e carismatici di sempre, nonostante questi ultimi non abbiano nemmeno un volto.

This game takes everything that was great about the first Portal and adds new levels of fun and complexity. The biggest selling-point for me was cooperative online play. Requiring two people to work together to solve the test chambers really builds teamwork between the players and it instills a feeling of accomplishment upon clearing that chamber that was starting to become a stumper. If you enjoyed the first Portal, this one is a must-have!

Portal 2 offers one of the best stories to ever come out of a game. Or at least the best writing. The gameplay is fluid, the puzzles are challenging, and it overall feels very complete. The multiplayer is fun, too.

Never thought the sequel could outshine the first in the series. But it did. And its awesome. -10/10-

Spectacular first-person puzzle game with awesome voice acting and many humourous moments that will have you laughing every 20-30 minutes. This game will challenge your problem-solving skills and really make you think outside the box in order to solve its more complex puzzles but it always feels rewarding when you finally do solve them. They also never reach that level of frustration where they're too overly complicated; they all feel just right and it really feels great when you get past an especially and perhaps initially counfounding problem until you realize the elegant solution and smack yourself for not having seen it sooner :P
The co-op is also a lot of fun as solving puzzles with your friend that are meant for 2 people is gloriously challenging and results in many high-five moments when you get through some seriously complex puzzles (must be noted, you can actually high-five each other in-game :D) that will have you going "oh hell no they didn't! xD"

10/10

Puzzle game. I like it.

Portal 1 starts outs as a simple puzzle game where you're promised with a cake, but in the end, you kill the robot of the Science lab. Suddenly, you're back at the labs, another robot who is trying to help you. But then, the robot is revived holding a grudge  against you killing her.

Portals gameplay is the same, but the game starts out easy at first, then it becomes more challenging to solve due to the new additions to the puzzles in Portal 2 such as gels. Co-Op is very fun when you're playing with a friend. 

Overall, excellent game, snag it if you want to try a challenging puzzle game in Portal 2.

Äusserst gelungene Fortsetzung des ersten Teils. Wer Portal mochte wird Portal2 lieben: Jede Menge neues, tödliches Spielzeug, eine packende Story und überwältigende Schauplätze, die einen nicht mehr loslassen bis man das Spiel komplett durchgezockt hat! Auch der neune Co-Op-Modus ist hervorragend umgesetzt und sorgt für tonnenweise Spielspass! Besser also eine Ferienwoche freihalten!

Mejoro cada aspecto de la primera parte: graficas, historia, mecanicas nuevas, mayor duracion y no solo eso, incluyo un asombroso multiplayer en el que la cooperación lo es todo. Sigues pensando en Portales? TIENES que jugarlo.
Fantastico e viciante!

As the people at Valve said, "Portal was a test bed. Portal 2 is a game." I cannot agree more.

Portal 2 brings the player back to mysterious Aperture Laboratories, many years after the first Portal happened. 

The game is at least twice as long Portal 1 with plenty of callbacks to it. The visuals are stunning and offer a wonderful sense of time, with the original 19 chambers completely overgrown and partially destroyed. With a glimpse into the beginning of Aperture the visuals deliver again, showing just how old the place really is, and how massive.

Aside from the vast storyline, the writing is extremely humorous. Characters such as Wheatley and Cave Johnson steal the show with their witty dialogue, while GLaDOS offers the same dry humor she did in the first game, only now with more well-written insults and a surprising backstory.

The Cooperative Testing Initiative gives you a whole new storyline with a two-person style of gameplay. With four portals, the tests get more challenging.

Extremely well put together, visionary title! Portal 2 reclaims the original splendor of its predecessor while synthesizing Portal's legendary gameplay mechanics into its own unique, well-defined experience, transcending the common pitfalls of producing a mere reiteration. While it seems unnecessary to point out, given Valve's integrity and approach to game development, it is not always guaranteed that a remarkable original translates to a respectable sequel. However, in this instance, the visionary qualities of Portal are easily detectable throughout Portal 2. No resting on laurels here. I strongly recommend giving this a shot, even if you're not particularly keen on most puzzlers.

One of the best games I've ever played and yet I haven't even tried co-op yet. Never a dull moment and possibly the best game you'll buy this gaming generation.

I love this because it has a robot with a Bristolian accent in it.  i thought it was Justin Lee Collins at first but it was Stephen Merchant, who co-wrote "the office".... It's a much longer game than the first one and somtimes I didn't finish the puzzles right away withought having a lie-down in a dark room for a bit first.  It has a brilliant climax and its funny all the way through - you know how hard it is to be funny in a computer game...?  Very hard.... But it manages it and consistently so.  All of the the developments of collective human endevour have led to this point - one small step for a robot, one giant leap for valve..... Buy it.

Just finished single player and co-op modes without ever using FAQs or Youtube clips. This feels soooooooooooo good! Co-op is a must try with your Steam friends, your jaws will hit the floor when you find out the easy / difficult puzzle solutions of each test room (if you haven't laughed yourself to death by then). 

I highly recommend you to finish the story mode first before starting with co-op, to get a feel of all possible portal tactics.

A genuinely unique and entertaining title be it the lengthy singleplayer campaign or the overwhelmingly engrossing co-op mode.  I was very surprised by just how impressed I was with this game and it's perfect mix of story and puzzles.  87/100.
